text: Kęty is a town in Oświęcim County, Lesser Poland Voivodeship, Poland with 18,955 inhabitants (2012). The town located in Silesian Foothills dates its earliest document from 1277 when Polish prince of Opole Władysław confirmed sale of the settlement and adoption of Lviv city rights. Settlement document The town's name comes from the word kąt (Polish for corner). The greatest development of the town came under the rule of Jagiellons, when the town became royal property.http://www.kety.pl/index.php?option=com_content&task;=view&id;=22&Itemid;=37 Official Page of the city The son of the mayor of the town of Kenty, Stanislaus Bacenga and his wife Anna became the Saint John Cantius, also known as John (Johann) of Kraków. St. Wyspiańskiego * Centrum Kształcenia Dorosłych w Kętach ==International relations== ===Twin towns — Sister cities=== Kęty is twinned with: * TurzovkaUchwała Nr XII/100/2003 Rady Miejskiej w Kętach z dnia 31 października 2003 r. w sprawie zawarcia umowy o Wzajemnej Współpracy między Gminą Kęty a miastem Turzovka. == References == ==External links== *Official town webpage * Jewish Community in Kęty on Virtual Shtetl Category:Cities and towns in Lesser Poland Voivodeship Category:Oświęcim County Category:Lesser Poland Category:Kraków Voivodeship (14th century – 1795) Category:Kingdom of Galicia and Lodomeria Category:Kraków Voivodeship (1919–1939)
